questions.question_text: How can a developer warn users of SOQL governor limit violations in a trigger?

discussion.content: https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.apexref.meta/apexref/apex_methods_system_limits.htm#apex_System_Limits_getQueries

choices.C: Use Limits.getQueries() and display an error message before the number of SOQL queries exceeds the limit.
choices.D: Use ApexMessage.Message() to display an error message after the number of SOQL queries exceeds the limit.
choices.A: Use Messaging.SendEmail() to continue the transaction and send an alert to the user after the number of SOQL queries exceeds the limit.
choices.B: Use PageReference.setRedirect() to redirect the user to a custom Visualforce page before the number of SOQL queries exceeds the limit.
